samples.title: Calling in Sick for a Fishing Trip

samples.title: Choosing Between Graduation and a Caribbean Cruise
samples.content: Your best friend is graduating this weekend, and you promised to attend the graduation. Today, your uncle sent you a message and invited you to go on a cruise with him to the Caribbean — all expenses paid for! You need to call one of them and explain why you can’t make it.

samples.title: Prioritizing Camping Over Helping Your Aunt Move
samples.content: Your aunt is moving this weekend, and you offered to help her. You receive a message from your friends inviting you to go camping with them this weekend. You need to call your friends or your aunt and explain why you can’t make it. What do you say?

samples.title: Discovering Damage to Borrowed iPad
samples.content: Your cousin recently borrowed your iPad when his family went on a road trip. After he returned it, you noticed a crack in the glass on the corner of the device. Call him up and explain the discovery. Ask him to pay for the repair.

samples.title: Choosing Between Vacation and Colleague's Wedding
samples.content: You recently booked flight tickets for your vacation to Mexico next month. Your colleague has suddenly announced his surprise wedding, which takes place over the dates of your vacation. Either call the airline company and ask for a refund, or call your colleague and explain to him why you can’t attend his wedding.

samples.title: Complaining About Swimming Pool Membership
samples.content: You recently bought a three-month membership at the swimming pool near your house. One week after buying the pass, the hot tub and sauna were shut down for renovations which will last two months. Call the swimming pool and voice your complaint. Demand a full or partial refund.

samples.title: Seeking a Shoe Exchange Without a Receipt
samples.content: You recently bought a new pair of shoes and realize that they are slightly too small. You want to exchange them for a larger pair but you can’t find the receipt! Call the store and explain your problem. Ask if you can exchange your shoes.

samples.title: Balancing Grandparents' Anniversary and Urgent School Project
samples.content: Your grandparents are celebrating their 50th wedding anniversary this Saturday. Your classmate, Anna, needs urgent help with a school project on Saturday. She might fail her class if you don’t help her. Talk to either your grandparents or Anna and explain your situation.

samples.title: Delaying Your Daughter's Smartphone Surprise
samples.content: Your daughter’s birthday is next week. She has wanted a new smartphone for a long time. Yesterday, you found a good deal on the latest iPhone and bought it. Today, she calls you from a store asking for your permission to buy the same one you bought for her. If you tell her that you already bought it for her, it will ruin the surprise. Tell her she can’t buy it and make up some reasons why she should wait.

samples.title: Dealing with a Restaurant Reservation Cancellation on Your Anniversary
samples.content: It’s your anniversary, and you booked a table at a fancy restaurant. One hour before going to the restaurant, you get a call from a person at the restaurant saying they overbooked the restaurant and will have to cancel your reservation. Either call the manager of the restaurant and demand that they fulfill your reservation, or talk to your spouse about a different option.

samples.title: Choosing Between Charity Event and Helping a Friend
samples.content: Your company is hosting a charity event tomorrow. Your boss has asked you to organize the event. You suddenly get a call from your friend asking for urgent help because his basement has flooded. Either call your friend and tell him you can’t help him, or call your boss and explain your friend’s situation.

samples.title: Handling a Speech Mishap at a Company Conference
samples.content: You are preparing to give a speech at your company’s annual conference. Ten minutes before your speech, your coworker accidentally spills coffee all over your pants. It looks like you peed your pants. You are embarrassed now and don’t know what to do. Either call your boss and tell him why you can’t give the speech, or give the speech and explain to everyone why your clothes are wet.

samples.title: Choosing Between a Friend's Party and Visiting Relatives
samples.content: Your aunt and uncle are driving through your city this weekend. They live far away, and you only get to see them once a year. They want to visit you this Saturday, but you already made plans to go to your friend’s housewarming party. Either call your friend and tell her you can’t attend her party, or call your uncle and aunt and tell them you won’t be able to see them.

samples.title: Are Parents the Best Teachers?
samples.content: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.

samples.title: Impact of Easy Food Preparation
samples.content: Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.

samples.title: Moving from Towns to Cities
samples.content: These days, many people are moving from towns to cities. Do you think this move will increase their quality of life? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.

samples.title: Children Having Smartphones
samples.content: It is becoming common these days for children to have their own smartphones. Do you think this trend is good or bad? Explain your reasons.

samples.title: Taxation on the Wealthy
samples.content: The gap between the rich and the poor is greater than ever before in history. The richest eight people control as much wealth as the poorest half of the world’s population. Do you think governments should increase taxes on the rich?

samples.title: Banning Children on Flights
samples.content: Frequent flyers often complain about crying babies on their flights. Should airlines consider banning children under 5 years old from their flights?

samples.title: Banning Fragrances in Public Places
samples.content: Some people are allergic to fragrances such as perfumes and colognes. Do you think fragrances should be banned in public places to make life easier for people with these allergies?

samples.title: Mandatory Homeschooling
samples.content: Many parents are choosing to homeschool their children because they have lost faith in the education system. Should the government make it mandatory for children to attend a normal school?

samples.title: Parental Restrictions on Movie Content
samples.content: Children these days often watch movies with violence, bad language, and sexual content. Do you think parents should place restrictions on what their kids can watch?

samples.title: Parental Responsibility for Education Costs
samples.content: Do you think parents should pay for their children’s education? Provide reasons to support your opinion.

samples.title: Reduced Working Hours
samples.content: In many countries, working 40 hours a week is standard; however, in some countries, such as the Netherlands, working 30 hours a week is average. Do you think governments should lower the number of hours people have to work?

samples.title: Graffiti as Art or Vandalism
samples.content: Graffiti is considered vandalism in Canada. Do you think the government should change this law to allow local artists to paint buildings, bridges, and other public areas?

samples.title: Government-funded Daycare
samples.content: Parents these days often put their children into daycare so that they can work. This is a real necessity especially for single parents. Do you think the government should provide free daycare for its citizens?
